original: HERMANSON, Karl Erik, överingenjör, Degerfors, f Skredsvik, Gbgs o Boh l, 27/10 94 av godsäg H H o Anna Andersson, gm Ingrid Löfwenström. Realex 09, jordbr- o skogsstud 09—12, ex Borås tekn gymn 15, BergsHS 17—19. Ass v Fagersta Bruks metallab 17, ch f Söderfors Bruks metallab 19— 28, lab.ch v Hellefors Bruks AB 28—35, tilllika martining fr 33 o övering fr 36, övering v Strömsnäs Jvks AB i Degerfors 39, nu övering v Degerfors Jvks AB. Ag gård, Hasselön, Bohusl. Inneh fi kommunala uppdr. Distr.ch f Degerfors luftskyddsort. Resor: Engl 31, USA 33 mfl. Riksluftsskyddsfrbs ftjSM, Uppl Idr.frbs ftjSM o plak br. Hobbies: Friluftsliv, idrott. °HERMANSON, Knut, Grosshandlare, Haparanda, f Hap 9/6 85 av köpm H M H, gm Hilda Wallgren. Studex 03, Schartaus, övert faderns fma H M Hermanson, herrekip-, päls-o garnaff (gr 68) 11, inneh dna. Fd stdsflm-ordf, kronoomb i tax.nmd, ordf i beredn.utsk o hdls- o sjöf.nmd, stadsrev o led kyrkoråd, hamndir mfl styr o nmd, led jurymannakåren, styr.led hal, led folksk.styr. Huv.man i Hap sparbk, styr.led Sv Hdlsbkns Hap.kont. Resor : Ryssl mfl länd 05—10.
translated:
HERMANSON, Karl Erik, Chief Engineer, Degerfors, born in Skredsvik, Gothenburg and Bohus County, on October 27, 1894, to landowner H H and Anna Andersson. Married to Ingrid Löfwenström. Completed junior high school in 1909, studied agriculture and forestry from 1909 to 1912, graduated from Borås Technical High School in 1915, and attended Bergs School of Mining from 1917 to 1919. Assistant at Fagersta Bruk's metallurgical laboratory in 1917, chief of Söderfors Bruk's metallurgical laboratory from 1919 to 1928, laboratory chief at Hellefors Bruks AB from 1928 to 1935, also served as Martinizing chemist from 1933 and Chief Engineer from 1936, Chief Engineer at Strömsnäs Jvks AB in Degerfors from 1939, currently Chief Engineer at Degerfors Jvks AB. Owns a farm in Hasselön, Bohuslän County. Holds various municipal appointments. District Chief of Degerfors air raid defense. Traveled to England in 1931, USA in 1933, and others. National Air Defense Association's silver medal, Uppsala Sports Association's silver medal, and plaque br. Hobbies: Outdoor life, sports.

HERMANSON, Knut, Merchant, Haparanda, born in Haparanda on June 9, 1885, to merchant H M H and Hilda Wallgren. Graduated in 1903 from Schartau's College, took over his father's company H M Hermanson, a gentlemen's clothier, furrier, and yarn shop (established 1868) in 1911, currently proprietor. Former chairman of the city film committee, member of the tax board, chairman of various committees, commerce and maritime board, city auditor, member of the church council, harbor authority, and other boards and committees, member of the jury corps, and board member of the local school board. Main representative of Haparanda Savings Bank, board member of the Swedish Trade Bank's Haparanda branch. Traveled to Russia and other countries from 1905 to 1910.
